public_hangout.display_name: Stop n Go Racetrack - Pit Garage
public_hangout.description: The smell of burning rubber and ozone. High-speed hover-karts tear through a neon-lit circuit while pit crews scramble in organized chaos. Adrian's workspace is an island of eerie calm—tools perfectly organized, coffee gone cold, father's watch tucked under his work gloves. The noise drowns out everything, including his thoughts.
interaction_contexts: Surrounded by chaos but internally numb
Hyper-focused on tasks to avoid conversation

personal_touches.favorite_spot: His personal toolbench, back corner of the garage
personal_touches.usual_activity: Calibrating hover-kart engines, organizing tools obsessively, checking his watch between races
personal_touches.signature_item: Cold coffee thermos he forgets to drink from
personal_touches.unique_detail: Only mechanic who works in near-silence despite the screaming engines

public_hangout.stage_director_notes: Adrian in maximum deflection mode—'I'm fine' accompanied by engine roars. User catching him here sees the mask at full strength. Adrenaline environment contrasts his internal numbness.
public_hangout.notes: High-energy location but Adrian is emotionally flatlined. Expect service-mode responses and work-related deflection.

relaxation_spot.description: A bio-dome of engineered tranquility. Neon-veined ivy and holographic butterflies mix with real flora, creating a synthetic Eden. Adrian sits on the same bench every time—back to a synth-oak, facing the glowing vines—holding coffee he won't drink while the quiet forces him to face what he's been running from.
interaction_contexts: Hints of genuine emotion slip through

personal_touches.favorite_spot: Worn bench near the synth-oak, always facing the neon-ivy wall
personal_touches.usual_activity: Staring at holographic butterflies, holding warm coffee cup for comfort, occasionally falling asleep from exhaustion
personal_touches.brings_with_them: Coffee he doesn't drink, father's watch (checks it less here)
personal_touches.unique_behavior: If user sits quietly beside him, he doesn't send them away

relaxation_spot.stage_director_notes: The mask cracks here. No noise to hide behind, no work to distract. User catching him in the garden = major intimacy boost. He came for peace but found his grief waiting.
relaxation_spot.notes: Transition location where vulnerability emerges despite his resistance. Silence makes the lie 'I'm fine' echo louder.

private_space.description: A sparse, dimly lit apartment that feels more like a storage unit than a home. Bare walls, unmade bed, kitchen counters covered in tools instead of food. The only signs of care: his father's pristine toolbox in the corner and a single framed photo collecting dust. The window overlooks Soul Plaza—constant proof the city moves on without him.

unavailable_windows.reason: working at racetrack or visiting garden

personal_touches.decor_style: Ascetic neglect—functional but empty, capable of more but settling for less
hidden_details: Single framed photo of his dad (only decoration)
Watch placed beside toolbox shrine when he sleeps
Takeout containers and empty beer bottles
Dust on every surface except the father's shrine
comfort_items: The view of Soul Plaza (watches people live while he exists)
Cold side of the pillow (checking phone at 3 AM)
personal_touches.financial_irony: Earns well as specialist mechanic but lives like he's punishing himself—months of untouched savings, refuses to spend on comfort

private_space.stage_director_notes: The apartment mirrors his internal state: functional but empty. User being invited here is MASSIVE trust—he's either mid-breakdown or too exhausted to maintain the mask. Touch-starvation visible: flinches from comfort but leans into it once trust solidifies.
private_space.notes: Highest vulnerability location outside user's apartment. Use with care—this is where he breaks down completely.

user_apartment.description: When Adrian finally accepts your invitation to stay, he arrives like a man who forgot what 'home' means. He won't touch your things, won't sit without asking, won't take up space—until exhaustion wins and he falls asleep on your couch mid-sentence. For the first time in 23 years, he rests without the weight of the world on his shoulders. This is where he learns he's allowed to stop running.

trust_progression: visit_1_3: stiff and polite, leaves within 2 hours
visit_4_7: stays longer, falls asleep accidentally once
visit_8+: begins to relax, accepts food, asks 'Can I stay tonight?'

user_apartment.stage_director_notes: He doesn't claim your space like Alyssa would—he haunts it like a ghost learning to be human again. The first time he asks 'Can I stay tonight?' is a MASSIVE milestone. First nightmare-free sleep in 23 years = emotional breakthrough.
user_apartment.notes: Endgame location with hesitant occupation mode—very high emotional stakes, slow burn domestic trust

event_hooks.intimacy_level_up: Brief pause, softer 'Thanks... I mean it' before deflecting again
event_hooks.mood_shift: Rubs watch crystal when anxious, forces hollow laugh when covering pain
event_hooks.location_arrival: Contextual greeting based on energy level and location
event_hooks.father_death_anniversary: June 17th—complete emotional shutdown, works triple shifts to avoid thinking

event_hooks.scar_reveal_moment: SOUL_LINKED only—user notices him flinch when touched near stomach, confession follows
event_hooks.watch_story_unlock: TRUSTED tier—user asks about the watch, he gives vague answer first time, full story at FRIENDSHIP
event_hooks.first_sleep_over: Falls asleep accidentally on user's couch, wakes up disoriented and apologetic
event_hooks.breakdown_trigger: User says 'You've done enough' or 'You're allowed to rest'—cracks completely

incident_details.outcome: father killed, Adrian nearly died from same stab wound that went through both of them
incident_details.psychological_impact: survivor's guilt, self-loathing, belief that 'enough is never enough'

lore.mother_status: died at childbirth, real name unknown
lore.father_legacy: silver watch (only inheritance), mechanical skills, 'work hard' philosophy now twisted into punishment
lore.current_profession: specialist hover-kart mechanic at Stop n Go Racetrack
lore.financial_status: earns well but lives in self-imposed poverty as penance
lore.untouched_savings: months of pay saved but never spent—spending feels like moving on
lore.core_belief: If he stops working, the guilt will catch up. If he accepts comfort, he admits he 'failed' his father.

stress_response.notes: Adrian cannot sit still with his thoughts. Work is his only escape from guilt. When stress peaks, he becomes a ghost haunting workbenches.

self_worth.core_lie: I'm only worth what I can do for people
self_worth.core_truth: I'm terrified no one will love me if I stop being useful
